title: Negation
text: We can find the solution to this problem by finding the probability that we get no black cards when we draw one card. What would this probability be?

title: Negation
text: Now what is the probability that when we draw two cards, neither of them are black? (This is the same probability that we draw two red cards)

title: Answer
text: Since we are looking for the probability that at least one card is black, this means that we will be looking for {BB, RB, BR}. This corresponds to the situation that we don't get {RR}. Since all these events are mutually exclusive, we can calculate this probability by the formula 1 - P(All Red). Since P(All Red) $$=$$ .25 as we calculated before, what is our final answer?
